description: From Russian бричка (brička), or its source, Polish bryczka, diminutive form of bryka (“carriage”), probably ultimately from Italian biroccio.

entries.meaning: (now chiefly historical) A type of horse-drawn carriage, with a foldable roof covering.
examples: The appearance of our caravan was curious and grotesque. Our britchka was drawn by three camels, taken in tow by a man on foot.
